DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text name of biospecimen used in the performance of immunological monitoring

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The study of the immune system and its reaction to pathogens, as well as its malfunctions (autoimmune diseases, allergies, rejection of organ transplants)._The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it)._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The study of the body's immune system.:The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).

Concepts.definition: The study of the immune system and its reaction to pathogens, as well as its malfunctions (autoimmune diseases, allergies, rejection of organ transplants).
The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).

Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The study of the immune system and its reaction to pathogens, as well as its malfunctions (autoimmune diseases, allergies, rejection of organ transplants)._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fluid that flows in and around the hollow spaces of the brain and spinal cord, and between two of the meninges (the thin layers of tissue that cover and protect the brain and spinal cord). CSF is made by tissue called the choroid plexus in the ventricles (hollow spaces) in the brain.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A peripheral blood cell with a single nucleus. This category includes lymphocytes and monocytes.

Concepts.definition: A peripheral blood cell with a single nucleus. This category includes lymphocytes and monocytes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
